Compute the precision matrix for multivariate spde Matern model

precision_matrix_multivariate_spde.Rd

Compute the precision matrix for multivariate spde Matern model

precision_matrix_multivariate_spde(
  p,
  mesh,
  rho,
  alpha_list = NULL,
  theta_K_list = NULL,
  variance_list = NULL,
  B_K_list = NULL,
  theta = NULL,
  Q = NULL
)

Arguments

p

dimension, should be integer and greater than 1

mesh

an inla.mesh.2d object, mesh for build the SPDE model

rho

vector with the p(p-1)/2 correlation parameters rho_11, rho_21, rho_22, ... rho_p1, rho_p2, ... rho_p(p-1)

theta_K_list

a list (length is p) of theta_K

variance_list

If provided, it should be a vector of length p, where the kth element corresponds to a desired variance of the kth field. The kth operator is then scaled by a constant c so that this variance is achieved in the stationary case (default no scaling)

B_K_list

a list (length is p) of B_K (non-stationary case)

theta

parameter for Q matrix (length of 1 when p=2, length of 3 when p=3)

Q

orthogonal matrix of dim p*p (provide when p > 3)

alpha

2 or 4, SPDE smoothness parameter

Value

the precision matrix of the multivariate model

Details

The general model is defined as $D diag(L_1, ..., L_p) x = M$. D is the dependence matrix, it is paramterized by $D = Q(theta) * D_l(cor_mat)$, where $Q$ is the orthogonal matrix, and $D_l$ is matrix controls the cross-correlation. See the section 2.2 of Bolin and Wallin (2020) for exact parameterization of Dependence matrix.

References

Bolin, D. and Wallin, J. (2020), Multivariate type G Matérn stochastic partial differential equation random fields. J. R. Stat. Soc. B, 82: 215-239. https://doi.org/10.1111/rssb.12351

Examples

library(INLA)
#> Loading required package: Matrix
#> Loading required package: sp
#> This is INLA_23.08.26 built 2023-08-26 14:24:50 UTC.
#>  - See www.r-inla.org/contact-us for how to get help.
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘INLA’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:ngme2’:
#> 
#>     f
library(fields)
#> Error in library(fields): there is no package called ‘fields’
# Define mesh
x <- seq(from=0,to=1,length.out = 40)
mesh <- inla.mesh.create(lattice = inla.mesh.lattice(x,x), extend = FALSE)
#> Error in if (n < 1) {    done <- TRUE    break}: missing value where TRUE/FALSE needed
# Set parameters
rho <- c(-0.5, 0.5,-0.25) #correlation parameters
log_kappa <- list(2,2,2) #log(kappa)
variances <- list(1,1,1) #set marginal variances to 1
alpha <- list(2,2,2) #smoothness parameters
# Compute precision
Q <- precision_matrix_multivariate_spde(p, mesh = mesh, rho = rho,
                                       alpha = alpha, theta_K_list = log_kappa,
                                       variance_list = variances)
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'p' not found

A <- as.vector(inla.spde.make.A(mesh,loc = matrix(c(0.5,0.5),1,2)))
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'mesh' not found
Sigma <- as.vector(solve(Q,c(A,rep(0,2*mesh$n))))
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'a' in selecting a method for function 'solve': object 'Q' not found
r11 <- Sigma[1:mesh$n]
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'Sigma' not found
r12 <- Sigma[(mesh$n+1):(2*mesh$n)]
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'Sigma' not found
r13 <- Sigma[(2*mesh$n+1):(3*mesh$n)]
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'Sigma' not found
Sigma <- as.vector(solve(Q,c(rep(0,mesh$n),A,rep(0,mesh$n))))
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'a' in selecting a method for function 'solve': object 'Q' not found
r22 <- Sigma[(mesh$n+1):(2*mesh$n)]
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'Sigma' not found
r23 <- Sigma[(2*mesh$n+1):(3*mesh$n)]
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'Sigma' not found
Sigma <- as.vector(solve(Q,v <- c(rep(0,2*mesh$n),A)))
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'a' in selecting a method for function 'solve': object 'Q' not found
r33 <- Sigma[(2*mesh$n+1):(3*mesh$n)]
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'Sigma' not found

proj <- inla.mesh.projector(mesh)
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'mesh' not found

par(mfrow=c(3,3))
image.plot(inla.mesh.project(proj,r11), main = "Cov(X_1(s0),X_1(s)")
#> Error in image.plot(inla.mesh.project(proj, r11), main = "Cov(X_1(s0),X_1(s)"): could not find function "image.plot"
plot.new()
plot.new()
image.plot(inla.mesh.project(proj,r12), main = "Cov(X_1(s0),X_2(s)")
#> Error in image.plot(inla.mesh.project(proj, r12), main = "Cov(X_1(s0),X_2(s)"): could not find function "image.plot"
image.plot(inla.mesh.project(proj,r22), main = "Cov(X_2(s0),X_2(s)")
#> Error in image.plot(inla.mesh.project(proj, r22), main = "Cov(X_2(s0),X_2(s)"): could not find function "image.plot"
plot.new()
image.plot(inla.mesh.project(proj,r13), main = "Cov(X_1(s0),X_3(s)")
#> Error in image.plot(inla.mesh.project(proj, r13), main = "Cov(X_1(s0),X_3(s)"): could not find function "image.plot"
image.plot(inla.mesh.project(proj,r23), main = "Cov(X_2(s0),X_3(s)")
#> Error in image.plot(inla.mesh.project(proj, r23), main = "Cov(X_2(s0),X_3(s)"): could not find function "image.plot"
image.plot(inla.mesh.project(proj,r33), main = "Cov(X_3(s0),X_3(s)")
#> Error in image.plot(inla.mesh.project(proj, r33), main = "Cov(X_3(s0),X_3(s)"): could not find function "image.plot"
